thread.title: Ground News - Brisbane Roar concede eight goals less than a week after coach's shock resignation
thread.title_full: Ground News - Brisbane Roar concede eight goals less than a week after coach's shock resignation

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Brisbane Roar concede eight goals less than a week after coach's shock resignation
text:
Summary by Ground News Brisbane Roar beaten 8-1 by Melbourne City in A-League Men's clash. Result equalled heaviest defeat in club's history. Roar lost coach Ross Aloisi on Christmas Eve. Caretaker coach Luciano Trani refuses to write off season. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
ABC Australia Lean Left High Factuality Government: Australian Government Brisbane Roar hammered 8-1 by Melbourne City less than a week after coach Ross Aloisi's resignation In the wake of Ross Aloisi's departure on Christmas Eve, the Roar fall to a 8-1 thrashing at the hands of Melbourne City, the result equalling the heaviest defeat in A-League Men history.
